leaders.name: Kim Jong Un
leaders.notes: Absolute control, strict repression, cult of personality.

leaders.name: Viktor Orbán
leaders.notes: Eroded democratic institutions, media control, centralized power.

leaders.name: Bashar al-Assad
leaders.notes: Civil war, human rights abuses, repressive regime.

leaders.name: Isaias Afwerki
leaders.notes: No elections, no constitution, no press freedom.

leaders.name: Xi Jinping
leaders.notes: Centralized power, abolished term limits, intensified censorship.

leaders.name: Vladimir Putin
leaders.notes: Suppressed opposition, media control, extended tenure.

leaders.name: Recep Tayyip Erdoğan
leaders.notes: Eroded democratic institutions, restricted press freedom.

leaders.name: Nicolás Maduro
leaders.notes: Accused of electoral fraud, economic crisis, repression.

leaders.name: Mohammed bin Salman
leaders.notes: Suppressed dissent, limited freedoms.

leaders.name: Daniel Ortega
leaders.notes: Election manipulation, opposition suppression.

leaders.name: Alexander Lukashenko
leaders.notes: "Europe's last dictator," disputed elections, repression.

leaders.name: Sheikh Hasina Wazed
leaders.notes: Long-time leader criticized for suppressing opposition and media.

leaders.name: Abdel Fattah el-Sisi
leaders.notes: Military leader who took power after coup, restricts civil liberties.

leaders.name: Ebrahim Raisi
leaders.notes: Hardline president in theocratic system with strict limits on freedoms.

leaders.name: Mohammed bin Zayed Al Nahyan
leaders.notes: Absolute monarchy with limited political freedoms.

leaders.name: Abiy Ahmed
leaders.notes: Nobel Peace Prize winner who later became criticized for civil conflict and repression.

leaders.name: Muammar Gaddafi
leaders.notes: Overthrown and killed during the Libyan Civil War.

leaders.name: Hosni Mubarak
leaders.notes: Resigned after mass protests (Arab Spring).

leaders.name: Robert Mugabe
leaders.notes: Ousted in a military coup.

leaders.name: Zine El Abidine Ben Ali
leaders.notes: Fled the country amid protests, sparking the Arab Spring movement.

leaders.name: Pervez Musharraf
leaders.notes: Seized power in a military coup and resigned amid impeachment threats.

leaders.name: Omar al-Bashir
leaders.notes: Deposed by the military after months of civilian protests.

leaders.name: Fidel Castro
leaders.notes: Led Cuba for nearly five decades before resigning due to health issues.

leaders.name: Islam Karimov
leaders.notes: Served as the country's first president until his death.

leaders.name: Hugo Chávez
leaders.notes: Implemented socialist policies until his death; succeeded by Maduro.

leaders.name: Nursultan Nazarbayev
leaders.notes: Resigned but retained influence as 'Leader of the Nation.'

leaders.name: Alberto Fujimori
leaders.notes: Suppressed democracy; later jailed for human rights abuses.

leaders.name: Adolf Hitler
leaders.notes: Nazi dictator, WWII, Holocaust; died by suicide in 1945.

leaders.name: Joseph Stalin
leaders.notes: Communist rule with purges, forced collectivization.

leaders.name: Benito Mussolini
leaders.notes: Fascist dictator; executed in 1945.

leaders.name: Francisco Franco
leaders.notes: Military dictator; rule ended with his death.

leaders.name: Mao Zedong
leaders.notes: Led Communist China, Great Leap Forward, Cultural Revolution.

leaders.name: Pol Pot
leaders.notes: Led Khmer Rouge, orchestrated genocide.

leaders.name: Idi Amin
leaders.notes: Military ruler, human rights abuses, mass killings.

leaders.name: Augusto Pinochet
leaders.notes: Military dictatorship, repression, disappearances.

leaders.name: Ferdinand Marcos
leaders.notes: Declared martial law, ruled autocratically, ousted by People Power Revolution.

leaders.name: Suharto
leaders.notes: Ruled for 30+ years before resigning amid protests.

leaders.name: Kim Il Sung
leaders.notes: Founder of North Korea, established the Kim dynasty.

leaders.name: Enver Hoxha
leaders.notes: Isolated Albania from the rest of the world.

leaders.name: Josip Broz Tito
leaders.notes: Ruled Yugoslavia independently from the USSR.

leaders.name: Anastasio Somoza Debayle
leaders.notes: Part of the Somoza dynasty; overthrown by the Sandinistas.

leaders.name: Jorge Rafael Videla
leaders.notes: Led Argentina's 'Dirty War' dictatorship.

leaders.name: Alfredo Stroessner
leaders.notes: Longest-ruling dictator in Latin America (35 years).

leaders.name: Rafael Trujillo
leaders.notes: Ruthless military dictatorship, assassinated.

leaders.name: Getúlio Vargas
leaders.notes: Populist turned authoritarian; committed suicide.

leaders.name: Juan Domingo Perón
leaders.notes: Charismatic leader with authoritarian tendencies.

leaders.name: Fulgencio Batista
leaders.notes: U.S.-backed dictator before being overthrown by Castro.

leaders.name: Joe Biden
leaders.notes: 46th president of the United States.

leaders.name: Justin Trudeau
leaders.notes: Prime Minister of Canada, leading a liberal government.

leaders.name: Claudia Sheinbaum
leaders.notes: First female president of Mexico.

leaders.name: Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva
leaders.notes: Returned to power after previous terms from 2003-2010.

leaders.name: Javier Milei
leaders.notes: Libertarian economist turned president.

leaders.name: Gabriel Boric
leaders.notes: Youngest president in Chile's history.

leaders.name: Gustavo Petro
leaders.notes: First leftist president in Colombia's modern history.

leaders.name: Dina Boluarte
leaders.notes: First female president of Peru.

leaders.name: Olaf Scholz
leaders.notes: Chancellor leading a coalition government.

leaders.name: Emmanuel Macron
leaders.notes: Centrist president elected on pro-EU platform.

leaders.name: Giorgia Meloni
leaders.notes: First female prime minister of Italy, leading right-wing coalition.

leaders.name: Keir Starmer
leaders.notes: Labour party leader who became Prime Minister after general election.

leaders.name: Pedro Sánchez
leaders.notes: Prime Minister leading a coalition government.

leaders.name: Alexander De Croo
leaders.notes: Prime Minister leading a coalition government.

leaders.name: Ulf Kristersson
leaders.notes: Prime Minister leading a center-right coalition.

leaders.name: Fumio Kishida
leaders.notes: Prime Minister from the Liberal Democratic Party.

leaders.name: Yoon Suk Yeol
leaders.notes: Conservative president elected in close race.

leaders.name: Narendra Modi
leaders.notes: Prime Minister from the BJP party.

leaders.name: Paetongtarn Shinawatra
leaders.notes: Prime Minister from the Pheu Thai party.

leaders.name: Anwar Ibrahim
leaders.notes: Long-time opposition leader who became Prime Minister.

leaders.name: Ferdinand Marcos Jr.
leaders.notes: Son of former dictator Ferdinand Marcos.

leaders.name: Anthony Albanese
leaders.notes: Labor party prime minister.

leaders.name: Christopher Luxon
leaders.notes: Prime Minister from the National Party.

leaders.name: Shehbaz Sharif
leaders.notes: Prime Minister leading coalition government.

leaders.name: Isaac Herzog
leaders.notes: President in largely ceremonial role.

leaders.name: Volodymyr Zelenskyy
leaders.notes: Former actor who became president, leading Ukraine during war with Russia.

leaders.name: William Ruto
leaders.notes: President elected in contested election.

leaders.name: Cyril Ramaphosa
leaders.notes: President from the ANC party.

leaders.name: Bola Tinubu
leaders.notes: President elected in controversial election.
